sen.j: 氷上 川継（ひかみ の かわつぐ、生没年不詳）は奈良時代から平安時代初期の皇族。
sen.e: HIKAMI no Kawatsugu (date of birth and death unknown) was Imperial family between the Nara period and the early Heian period.
HIKAMI no Kawatsugu (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family between the Nara period and the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: date→year,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。a member of the を補いました。
sen.e: HIKAMI no Kawatsugu (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family between the Nara period and the early Heian period.

sen.j: 天武天皇の曾孫。
sen.e: He was a great-grandchild of Emperor Tenmu.
He was a great-grandchild of the Emperor Tenmu.
He was a great-grandchild of the Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 塩焼王（氷上塩焼）と不破内親王の子。
sen.e: His parent was Prince Shioyaki (HIKAMI no Shioyaki) and Imperial Princess Fuwa.
His parents were the Prince Shioyaki (HIKAMI no Shioyaki) and the Imperial Princess Fuwa.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。parent was→parents were と修正しました。
sen.e: His parents were the Prince Shioyaki (HIKAMI no Shioyaki) and the Imperial Princess Fuwa.

sen.j: 妻は藤原浜成（藤原京家）の娘法壱。
sen.e: His wife was FUJIWARA no Hofuichi, a daughter of FUJIWARA no Hamanari (the Western House of the Fujiwara clan).
His wife was FUJIWARA no Hofuichi, a daughter of FUJIWARA no Hamanari (the Western House of the Fujiwara clan).
His wife was FUJIWARA no Hofuichi, a daughter of FUJIWARA no Hamanari (the Western House of the Fujiwara clan).

sen.j: 同母兄に氷上志計志麻呂がいる。
sen.e: His maternal half-brother was HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro.
HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro was his maternal half-brother.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro was his maternal half-brother.

sen.j: （同一人物との説もある）
sen.e: (Some theory say that two of them are same person)
(A theory says that the two of them are the same person)
sen.cmt: Some→A,say→says と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: (A theory says that the two of them are the same person)

sen.j: 父の塩焼王は臣籍降下して氷上真人姓を賜る。
sen.e: His father, Prince Shioyaki demoted from nobility to subject and was granted Hikami no Mahito (the highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His father, the Prince Shioyaki was demoted from nobility to subject, and was granted Hikami no Mahito (the highest of the eight hereditary titles).
sen.cmt: the, was, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: His father, the Prince Shioyaki was demoted from nobility to subject, and was granted Hikami no Mahito (the highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年）塩焼王は藤原仲麻呂の乱で偽帝に擁され処刑されたが、母の不破内親王と川継は罰されなかった。
sen.e: Although Prince Shioyaki was executed since he was backed up for the imperial throne at FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's war In 764, Kawatsugu and his mother, Imperial Princess Fuwa weren't subject to punishment.

Although the Prince Shioyaki was executed since he was supported to become a fake emperor in the FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's war in 764, Kawatsugu and his mother, the Imperial Princess Fuwa were not punished.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。since he was backed up for the imperial throne→since he was supported to become a fake emperor,at→in,weren't subject to punishment→were not punished と修正しました。
sen.e: Although the Prince Shioyaki was executed since he was supported to become a fake emperor in the FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's war in 764, Kawatsugu and his mother, the Imperial Princess Fuwa were not punished.

sen.j: 宝亀10年（779年）従五位下に叙される。
sen.e: He was granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 779.
He was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 779.
He was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 779.

sen.j: 延暦元年（782年）因幡国国司となる。
sen.e: He became a provincial governor in Inaba Province in 782.
He became a provincial governor in Inaba Province in 782.
He became a provincial governor in Inaba Province in 782.

sen.j: 同年閏正月、川継の資人の大和乙人が武器を持って宮中に闖入して捕らえられる事件が起き、乙人は川継の謀反を自白した。
sen.e: On January 22, 782, YAMATO no Otohito, Kawatsugu's armed shijin (lower-rank officers provided to the Imperial or noble families and used as a guard or miscellaneous services), was discovered and arrested in the Imperial Palace and Otohiko confessed Kawatsugu's rebellion.

On January 22, 782, YAMATO no Otohito, who was Kawatsugu's shijin (lower-rank officers provided to the Imperial or noble families and used as a guard or miscellaneous services), armed and intruded into the Imperial Place then arrested, and Otohiko confessed the Kawatsugu's rebellion.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。尚、この日付についての確認ができません。
sen.e: On February 21, 782, YAMATO no Otohito, who was Kawatsugu's shijin (lower-rank officers provided to the Imperial or noble families and used as a guard or miscellaneous services), armed and intruded into the Imperial Place then arrested, and Otohiko confessed the Kawatsugu's rebellion.
sen.cmt: 閏正月なのでこの場合のグレゴリオ暦は、January 22→February 21としました。

sen.j: 川継は逃亡するが大和国で捕らえられた。
sen.e: Kawatsugu ran away but he was caught in Yamato Province.
Kawatsugu ran away but he was arrested in Yamato Province.
Kawatsugu ran away but he was arrested in Yamato Province.

sen.j: 極刑に値するところ死一等を減じられて伊豆国へ流罪となった。
sen.e: Despite his charge was worth to the death penalty, he was escaped a death punishment to lower one and deported to Izu Province.
Despite the charge was worth the death penalty, he escaped the death punishment to the lower one, and exiled to Izu Province.
sen.cmt: to を削除しました。his→the,was escaped→escaped,a→the,deported→exiled と修正しました。the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Despite the charge was worth the death penalty, he escaped the death punishment to the lower one, and exiled to Izu Province.

sen.j: 不破内親王は淡路国へ流され、またこの事件に連座して舅の参議・藤原浜成、参議・大伴家持、右衛士督・坂上苅田麻呂らも処罰された。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Fuwa was deported to Awaji Province and his father-in-low, councilor FUJIWARA no Hamanari and OTOMO no Yakamochi, as well as Guard chief SAKANOUE no Karitamaro were punished together for their involvement in that incident.

The Imperial Princess Fuwa was exiled to Awaji Province, and also those who involved in this incident such as, his father-in-low, councilor FUJIWARA no Hamanari and OTOMO no Yakamochi, Guard chief SAKANOUE no Karitamaro were punished.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。deported→exiled と修正しました。よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Fuwa was exiled to Awaji Province, and also those who involved in this incident such as, his father-in-low, councilor FUJIWARA no Hamanari and OTOMO no Yakamochi, Guard chief SAKANOUE no Karitamaro were punished.

sen.j: （氷上川継の乱）
sen.e: (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War)
(HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War)
(HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War)

sen.j: 大同 (日本)元年（806年）罪を許され帰京。
sen.e: Kawatsugu was forgiven his charge and returned to Kyoto in 806.
Kawatsugu was forgiven his crime and returned to Kyoto in 806.
Kawatsugu was forgiven his crime and returned to Kyoto in 806.

sen.j: 従五位下に復す。
sen.e: He was back to Jugoi again.
He was back to the Jugoi again.
He was back to the Jugoi again.

sen.j: 大同4年（809年）典薬頭。
sen.e: He become Tenyaku no kami (the head of Tenyaku ryo, the Bureau of Medicine) in 809.
He become Tenyaku no kami (the head of Tenyaku ryo, the Bureau of Medicine) in 809.
He become Tenyaku no kami (the head of Tenyaku ryo, the Bureau of Medicine) in 809.

sen.j: 弘仁3年（812年）伊豆守となる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Governor of Izu Province in 812.
He was appointed to the Governor of Izu Province in 812.
He was appointed to the Governor of Izu Province in 812.

sen.j: 以後史書に記録がなく、間もなく他界したものと見られる。
sen.e: Since no record of him was recorded in any historic books, it is assumed that he died soon after.
There is no record of him afterwards on any history books; it is assumed that he died soon after.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: There is no record of him afterwards on any history books; it is assumed that he died soon after.
